senses.sense_definition: The family name of an ancient Roman, indicating the clan to which they belonged.

examples.text: In the name Gaius Julius Caesar, Julius is the <w>nomen</w>.
His <w>nomen</w> revealed that he was a member of a powerful patrician family.

senses.sense_definition: A technical name assigned to an organism in biological classification.

examples.text: The scientist argued that the current <w>nomen</w> for the species was invalid.
Taxonomists must follow strict codes when establishing a new <w>nomen</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The birth name of an ancient Egyptian pharaoh, traditionally written inside a cartouche.

examples.text: The archaeologist identified the king by reading the <w>nomen</w> in the inscription.
A pharaoh's <w>nomen</w> was usually preceded by the title 'Son of Ra'.
